org.apache.archiva.repository.storage

Class FilesystemAsset

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.archiva.repository.storage.FilesystemAsset
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable, StorageAsset

    public class FilesystemAsset
extends Object
implements StorageAsset, Comparable
    Implementation of an asset that is stored on the filesystem.

    The implementation does not check the given paths. Caller should normalize the asset path and check, if the base path is a parent of the resulting path.

    The file must not exist for all operations.

    Author:
    Martin Stockhammer

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilesystemAsset

        public FilesystemAsset(RepositoryStorage storage,
                       String path,
                       Path assetPath)
        Creates an asset for the given path. The given paths are not checked. The base path should be an absolute path.
        Parameters:
        path - The logical path for the asset relative to the repository.
        assetPath - The asset path.

      • FilesystemAsset

        public FilesystemAsset(RepositoryStorage storage,
                       String path,
                       Path assetPath,
                       Path basePath,
                       boolean directory)
        Creates an asset for the given path. The given paths are not checked. The base path should be an absolute path.
        Parameters:
        path - The logical path for the asset relative to the repository
        assetPath - The asset path.
        directory - This is only relevant, if the represented file or directory does not exist yet and is a hint.

      • FilesystemAsset

        public FilesystemAsset(RepositoryStorage storage,
                       String path,

        directory - This is only relevant, if the represented file or directory does not exist yet and is a hint.

      • getWriteStream

        public OutputStream getWriteStream(boolean replace)
                            throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: StorageAsset
        Returns an output stream where you can write data to the asset. The operation is not locked or synchronized. User of this method have to make sure, that the stream is proper closed after usage.
        Specified by:
        getWriteStream in interface StorageAsset
        Parameters:
        replace - If true, the original data will be replaced, otherwise the data will be appended.
        Returns:
        The OutputStream where the data can be written.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • replaceDataFromFile

        public boolean replaceDataFromFile(Path newData)
                            throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: StorageAsset
        Replaces the content. The implementation may do an atomic move operation, or keep a backup. If the operation fails, the implementation should try to restore the old data, if possible. The original file may be deleted, if the storage was successful.
        Specified by:
        replaceDataFromFile in interface StorageAsset
        Parameters:
        newData - Replaces the data by the content of the given file.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getFilePath

        public Path getFilePath()
                 throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Description copied from interface: StorageAsset
        Returns the real path to the asset, if it exist. Not all implementations may implement this method. The method throws UnsupportedOperationException, if and only if StorageAsset.isFileBased() returns false.
        Specified by:
        getFilePath in interface StorageAsset
        Returns:
        The filesystem path to the asset.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - If the underlying storage is not file based.

      • isFileBased

        public boolean isFileBased()
        Description copied from interface: StorageAsset
        Returns true, if the asset can return a file path for the given asset. If this is true, the StorageAsset.getFilePath() will not throw a UnsupportedOperationException
        Specified by:
        isFileBased in interface StorageAsset
